      • parseMsgString

        public abstract void parseMsgString(java.lang.String s)
        Recreates the board game's state from a string representation. In particular, the string is a string generated as a "message" string (i.e., one without newlines). This method must be able to fill in the "board", who's next, number of moves performed, and whether or not the game ends with this move.
        Parameters:
        s - Message string representation of the state.

      • toString

        public abstract java.lang.String toString()
        Convert to a string
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String representation of the State, suitable for display

      • msgString

        public abstract java.lang.String msgString()
        Convert to a string suitable for tournament (i.e., no newlines)
        Returns:
        String representation of the State, suitable for tournament communication.

      • moveOK

        public abstract boolean moveOK(GameMove mv)
        Determines if a particular move is legal, given the current board configuration.
        Parameters:
        mv - Move to be made
        Returns:
        true if the move is valid
